links.title: Shigir Idol - Wikipedia
links.description:
The Shigir Sculpture, or Shigir Idol (Russian: Шигирский идол), is the oldest known wooden sculpture in the world,[1][2] made during the Mesolithic period, shortly after the end of the last Ice Age.[3] The wood it was carved from is approximately 11,500 years old.[4][5]
It is displayed in the  Sverdlovsk Regional Museum of Local Lore [ru] in Yekaterinburg, Russia.[6]

links.title: Frequency mixer - Wikipedia
links.description: In electronics, a mixer, or frequency mixer, is a nonlinear electrical circuit that creates new frequencies from two signals applied to it. In its most common application, two signals are applied to a mixer, and it produces new signals at the sum and difference of the original frequencies.  Other frequency components may also be produced in a practical frequency mixer.

links.title: Combination tone - Wikipedia
links.description: A combination tone (also called resultant or subjective tone)[2] is a psychoacoustic phenomenon of an additional tone or tones that are artificially perceived when two real tones are sounded at the same time. Their discovery is credited to the violinist Giuseppe Tartini (although he was not the first, see Georg Andreas Sorge) and so are also called Tartini tones.

links.title: Gestalt psychology - Wikipedia
links.description: Gestalt psychology (/ɡəˈʃtælt, -ˈʃtɑːlt, -ˈʃtɔːlt, -ˈstɑːlt, -ˈstɔːlt/ gə-SHTA(H)LT, -STAHLT, -S(H)TAWLT,[1][2] German: [ɡəˈʃtalt] (listen); meaning "form"[3]) or gestaltism is a German term interpreted in psychology as "pattern" or "configuration".[4] It is a school of psychology created by Max Wertheimer, Wolfgang Köhler, and Kurt Koffka.[4] The school emerged in Austria and Germany in the early twentieth century.[4] Gestalt psychology was fo...

links.title: Maintaining the kernel's web of trust
links.description:
A typical kernel development cycle involves pulling patches from over 100
repositories into the mainline.  Any of those pulls could conceivably
bring with it malicious code, leaving the kernel (and its users) open to
compromise.  The kernel's web of trust helps maintainers to ensure that
pull requests are legitimate, but that web has become difficult to maintain
in the wake of the recent attacks on key
servers and other problems.  So now the kern...

Castling is permitted also when there are pieces between the king and
the rook, but this means that these pieces are simultaneously removed
from play.

Comment
There are several occasions where one could want to take a piece -
especially taking pawns can be tactical in several cases. This variant
has the nice feature that it is very close to orthodox chess, while still
different. I am not sure that there are many cases where the additional
castl...

Beginning in 2004, the Arimaa community held three annual tournaments: a World Championship (humans only), a Computer Championship (computers only), and the Arimaa Challenge (human vs. computer).
